definition: to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
old variant of 笑[xiao4]
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The anecdotes of Wuling is a very funny movie.
sentences.chinese: 《武林别传》是一部爆笑的电影。

sentences.english: Rofl, I bet that was a sight.
The house burst into laughter after hearing the joke.
sentences.chinese: 听完这个笑话后满屋子的人发出一阵爆笑。

sentences.english: Adding laughter and silliness to your life will be a game changer.
sentences.chinese: 在你生活里加入爆笑点和傻气能改变你的游戏。

sentences.english: Which scene is the funniest in DC?
sentences.chinese: 那个是柯南里最爆笑的镜头？

definition: to get people to laugh/funny/hilarious
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
entertaining/hilarious
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
(coll.) to burst out laughing
comedic material/(in reference to a person) laughingstock/butt of jokes
to split one's sides laughing
spoof (web-based genre in PRC, acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)
funny bits/humorous parts/jokes/punchline
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
comedy/CL:部[bu4],齣|出[chu1]
(loanword) humor/humorous
humorous/jocular/zany
item of storytelling or performed dialogue (folk arts)/sketch
